This song was originally written by Phil Medley with Bert Berns and recorded by the Top Notes. It was then popularized by The Isley Brothers, only to be immortalized by the Fab Four themselves.

Well, work it on out (Work it on out)
 You know you look so good (Look so good)
 You know you got me goin’, now (Got me goin’)
 Just like I knew you would (Like I knew you would)

Please Please Me, the very album where “Twist and Shout” is featured, was “recorded, mixed, and edited” in about 25 hours. That day John Lennon had an unfortunate cold. He sung lead on most of the album’s songs, and was sucking on cough drops and gargling milk all day to soothe his throat.

Twist and Shout was saved for last because of their knowing that it would put the most strain on John’s voice.

That song nearly killed me. My voice wasn’t the same for a long time after; every time I swallowed, it was like sandpaper.

-John Lennon
